doc:
Reizl Bozyk https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reizl_Bozyk 0 Reizl Bozyk (born 13 May 1914, Poland – 1 October 1993, New York, New York, USA), also known as Rose Bozyk and Róża Bożyk, was a Polish-born American actress of the Yiddish theatre. Her claim to mainstream fame was her sole film role in which she played the interfering grandmother of Amy Irving in Joan Micklin Silver's film Crossing Delancey (1988). She also appeared in a memorable "Law and Order" episode "Night and Fog" which aired in season 3. Reizl_Bozyk ( born 13_May_1914 , Poland – 1_October_1993 , New_York , New_York , USA ) , also_known as Rose_Bozyk and Róża_Bożyk , was a_Polish-born_American_actress of the_Yiddish_theatre . Her_claim to mainstream_fame was her_sole_film_role in which she played the_interfering_grandmother of Amy_Irving in Joan_Micklin_Silver 's_film_Crossing_Delancey_(_1988_) . She also appeared in a_memorable_"_Law_and_Order_"_episode " Night_and_Fog " which aired in season_3 .
